item.title: 10 Best Co-Op Games Of The Last 10 Years
item.description:
Video games were a more collective experience in the 80s and 90s in person. There were arcades where players gathered, and even if they were playing solo games, they often attracted watchers. Plus, there were co-op games from brawlers to shooters.

Couch co-op was big for home consoles too, and since then, multiplayer has evolved thanks to online support. It feels like it has grown even more over the past decade, with better internet connections, more powerful consoles, and innovative gameplay ideas. From 2015 to 2025, these co-op games have offered the best experiences online and offline, and it will be exciting to see where co-op gaming goes next.

Destiny 2

A Platform For Looter Shooters

Destiny 2
53
7.7 /10
Released
August 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For TEEN for Blood, Language, and Violence
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Three-Six Online

Destiny 2 has been going strong since 2017, with many shifts in its development, such as going free-to-play. There are various ways to play cooperatively with partners, the biggest of which happens with three-player Strike missions, but there are also bigger Raids and the ability to find partners while exploring planets. Shooting always feels good in a Bungie game, and the same is true for Destiny 2 , whether players are enjoying co-op or going it alone.

Split Fiction

Moment To Moment Co-Op

Split Fiction
19
8.8 /10
Released
March 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Hazelight Studios
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Two Local/Online

Hazelight Studios has been a big developer in the co-op scene, perpetuating the idea that playing together with friends is a magical experience. Their latest game, Split Fiction , is their wildest yet, as there is no consistency between levels, as mechanics and even themes change from fantasy to sci-fi. It will keep players on their toes, whether they are hatching dragons or cruising along Tron-inspired highways. Split Fiction is always going to delight and surprise its two co-op partners.

Diablo 4

A Great Co-Op Game For The Spooky Season

Diablo 4
9 /10
105
7.5 /10
Released
June 6, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Two Local/Four Online

Diablo 4 is, unsurprisingly, a great co-op game, like every entry in the Diablo series that came before. Console players can team up on the couch, and online players can get a good group going as they explore an open-world from a top-down perspective. The perspective may look small, but the world is massive, as are the options given to players between classes and skill trees. Itâ€™s a great game to replay multiple times with different sets of friends with different class combinations.

Baldur's Gate 3

A Narrative Co-Op Experience

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
141
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Two Local/Four Online

Baldur's Gate 3 is a different co-op experience than most, as the game as a whole is focused on the narrative with many dynamic choices. If players progress with friends, they can experience the story together and communicate options, almost like a massive choose-your-own-adventure game.

Gameplay is turn-based, meaning each player has to wait for their turn. There arenâ€™t many turn-based co-op games out there, and Baldur's Gate 3 certainly sits at the top for those who want something different.

Super Mario Bros. Wonder

Mario Goes Weird

Super Mario Bros. Wonder
9.0 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Four Local

Super Mario Bros. Wonder is the latest 2D entry in the Mario series, and it's fun to play on either the Switch or Switch 2. Players can team up locally with a max party of four and explore wondrous levels, which show that Nintendo still hasnâ€™t lost its edge. From singing flowers to turning characters into elephants or goo, Super Mario Bros. Wonder keeps things surprising, and itâ€™s still fun to go back to, thanks to the short, almost bite-sized design of levels.

Tom Clancy's The Division

Money Problems

Tom Clancyâ€™s The Division
8.5 /10
Released
March 8, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Four Online

Tom Clancy's The Division was one of the first major games to follow Destinyâ€™s looter shooter and live-service model. Instead of a first-person shooter, players could squad up for third-person shooting and cover-based tactics. It was a fun new idea for the Tom Clancy series, with one of the most bizarre setups for a post-apocalypse yet. The story involved Black Friday-tainted money that diseased the U.S., sending the nation into turmoil. Only an elite squadron of special forces could fight back, aka The Division.

Elden Ring

Prepare To Co-Op

Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Three Online

Elden Ring , like many of FromSoftwareâ€™s Soulslike games, offers players co-op options. As one of the most brutally challenging games around, playing with friends can make exploring the world and fighting baddies and bosses that much easier. It also helps prevent the host player from getting absolutely owned by invaders online. Itâ€™s not impossible to beat the game alone, but friends certainly make the experience easier.

Monster Hunter Wilds

Danger Around Every Corner

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Four Online

Monster Hunter Wilds is one of the most inviting games in this series for new players, thanks to the NPC party options. As great as these AI-controlled party members are, the game still thrives as a four-player co-op experience.

Itâ€™s also one of the few games that let players truly showcase their creativity through their created characters and customized armor sets. The world is open with plenty of new monsters to slay, and each weapon class helps create dynamic setups for any given monster slaying party, from the easy-to-use bow to the strong but hard-to-master Insect Glaive.

Path Of Exile 2

A Proper Challenger To Diablo

Path of Exile II
Action RPG
Systems
9 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Nudity, Violence
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Two Local/Six Online

Path of Exile 2 is still in early access, but it feels like a finished game. The world is expansive, but not open, with many classes to choose from and a spell system not unlike the Materia system from Final Fantasy 7 . What sets Path of Exile 2 apart from other Diablo clones is that the world is randomly generated, making each playthrough unique in some respects. Itâ€™s another great reason to replay the game, along with testing new classes with friends.

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredderâ€™s Revenge

Pizza Time!

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
June 16, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by
  • Co-Op Options: Six Local/Online

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredderâ€™s Revenge is a throwback to the good old days of 80s and 90s brawlers. Specifically, itâ€™s a spiritual successor to Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtles in Time as it picks up where that game left off. Similar to other modern brawlers, there are new features to make it feel new and not just another homage. Every character can level up and learn new skills, plus it features six-player co-op action. This can make screens look a bit hectic, but thatâ€™s par for the course for these turtle bros.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows: How Ubisoft Bordeaux Brought a Side-Scroller to Life in Claws of Awaji
item.description:
Early in the Claws of Awaji DLC, Assassin's Creed Shadows players will play through a side-scroller that narrates key events ahead of their arrival on the island. In it, players will play as two different members of the Sanzoku Ippa and then as Naoe's mother, Tsuyu. This side-scroller is related to Awaji because of the region's culture with puppet shows, but interestingly, the idea of a side-scroller came first.

During a trip to Ubisoft Bordeaux, Game Rant was able to speak with Claws of Awaji content director Simon Arseneault, following a presentation, about the side-scroller. It began as something of an experiment for the Assassin's Creed Shadows DLC, with the side-scroller initially being presented as a shadow play. Even in these early prototype forms, it seemed like an homage to the side-scrolling Assassin's Creed Chronicles games. Claws of Awaji's side-scroller isn't as in-depth as they were, but it does a great job of giving key narrative and exposition beats without being a cinematic, setting the tone and key characters players can expect in their time on Awaji.

Making An AC Shadows Side-Scroller

When I spoke with Arseneault, I was really curious about how it went from this experimental prototype to his "desk" to the final product in the game. Arseneault revealed he wasn't quite sure what to do with it at first. It's cool, but how does it fit into Claws of Awaji and the game world? That's the question at the heart of this side-scroller. Similarly, how would it happen in gameplay? Arseneault thought the 'flipping a door as it opens' approach wouldn't quite fit the vibe. Luckily, research was the answer to both questions.

As Ubisoft properly researched and began the work (as this prototype experiment was earlier), Arseneault learned how Awaji Island is known for the traditional art of puppet shows, and so the initial idea transition from a shadow play to a puppet show. That's how this could fit into Assassin's Creed Shadows ' Claws of Awaji DLC, with Arseneault explaining,

"We put it on the shelf and started researching, and that's when the spark came up. When we started the puppet show, that's where we could connect this, and now it works. Now there's a way to make this idea work, and it's going to give us something unique you've never seen before. It's almost like an homage to AC Chronicles, so we can play on it."

Will There Be More Side Scrollers in the Future?

Somewhat unfortunately, fans can only expect the one side-scroller in the Claws of Awaji DLC. Incorporating a side-scroller in Assassin's Creed Shadows was an expensive and long endeavor, lasting around 14 months or so to make just one. Arseneault said, "I wish we could have done more of those things, for sure, but it was pricey enough for just one. It's long, hard work, but it also allowed us to foreshadow our characters. That's something we have a hard time doing sometimes in AC except with cinematics. That's our go-to often because that's where we control everything. Here, we still have some control, but we're able to show a different vibe of it."

It's interesting, however, to see the sentiment around the side-scroller. While how it is ultimately received remains in the air, the question on the mind of everyone in the presentation was "Is there only one side-scroller in the DLC?" Resources did prevent more from happening, but at the same time, that's ultimately a good sentiment because it means fans, at least some, may want more. I certainly do. I would take it in future DLCs, I would take another Assassin's Creed Chronicles game, and I would appreciate more unique segments like this. But it is reasonable given the development timeline, and Arseneault understandably could not say if more in the future was possible or not:

76
8.0 /10
9 /10

Assassin's Creed Shadows

Follow
Followed
Action
Stealth
RPG
Systems
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 81 /100 Critics Rec: 82%
Released

Developer(s)

item.title: Roblox: Tower Defense Simulator Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Tower Defense Simulator Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes In Tower Defense Simulator

There are many experiences in the tower defense genre, but Tower Defence Simulator stands out due to its atmosphere, well-designed maps, and interesting enemies. This article will be useful for Roblox players looking for freebies in this experience. Here they can find a complete list of Tower Defence Simulator codes and information about the rewards that they all offer.

Updated September 17, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: At the moment, thereâ€™s only one active code for Tower Defense Simulator , and it provides a crate you can claim. Itâ€™s a simple bonus, but still worth redeeming if you want something extra. More codes could be added in the future, so checking back from time to time is a good idea. Updates often bring fresh rewards, and weâ€™ll keep this guide updated with the latest.

All Tower Defense Simulator Codes

Active Tower Defense Simulator Codes

  • NOTESLA? - Enter this code to claim a Crate. (NEW)

Expired Tower Defense Simulator Codes

  • 4BVisits - Enter this code to claim rewards.
  • EnterCodeHere - Enter this code to claim a Crate.
  • 1POINT7MIL - Enter this code to claim a Farm Tower Skin.
  • TDS5YEARS! - Enter this code to claim a 1 Party Skincrate.
  • MERRY2024 - Enter this code to claim Cookie Scout and 1 Holiday Crate.
  • IMCONSUMING - Enter this code to claim a Mid Grade Consumable Crate.
  • QNJOU11 - Enter this code to claim a Premium Crate.
  • HAPPYHALLOWEEN - Enter this code to claim a Halloween Skin Crate.
  • NAMETAGSRCOOL - Enter this code to claim a Name Tag.
  • JOHNRETURNS - Enter this code to claim the John Skin.
  • M3RRY2022TDS - Enter this code to claim a Cookie Scout.
  • beachglad2022 - Enter this code to claim Beach Gladiator skin.
  • MERRY2021 - Enter this code to claim Present Skin.
  • robloxisback - Enter this code to claim Premium Skincrate.
  • 1BILLION - Enter this code to claim Deluxe Crate.
  • COMMUNITY20 - Enter this code to claim Mini Skin.
  • celebration21 - Enter this code to claim 1 Party Crate.
  • 200KMAY - Enter this code to claim 500 Gems.
  • BLOXY21 - Enter this code to claim Commander Skin.
  • FIFTYK - Enter this code to claim 200 Coins.
  • delayed - Enter this code to claim a Premium Crate.
  • imababy - Enter this code to claim 100 Gems.
  • newyear2021 - Enter this code to claim 1 Premium Crate.
  • 30k - Enter this code to claim 1 Pumpkin Crate.
  • DOUBLEBLOXIES - Enter this code to claim Cowboy Skin.
  • ICYFREEZE - Enter this code to claim Freezer Skin.
  • W33KLICODE - Enter this code to claim +65 experience.
  • 5KMILESTONE - Enter this code to claim Minigunner Twitter Skin.
  • B1RDHUNT3R - Enter this code to claim Hunter Troop.
  • 1pumpkin - Enter this code to claim 1 Pumpkin Crate.
  • SPR1NGM1L3ST0NE - Enter this code to claim Springtime Skin.
  • HAPPY3AST3R! - Enter this code to claim Springtime Skin.
  • ELECTRO - Enter this code to claim 100 Coins.
  • SW33TXP - Enter this code to claim 100 XP.
  • 02MOMENT - Enter this code to claim XP.
  • MOARXP - Enter this code to claim XP.

How to Redeem Codes In Tower Defense Simulator

The process of redeeming codes in Tower Defence Simulator is quite similar to other Roblox games, so if players have previous experience, they shouldn't face any problems. For fans who are still confused about redeeming codes, there is a detailed guide below:

  • Launch Roblox: Tower Defence Simulator .
  • Press the button with the Twitter(X) icon located at the bottom of the screen.
  • Enter one of the above codes in the Enter Code Here field.
  • Click Redeem to receive the reward.

item.title: Borderlands 4: Bio Bulkhead Boss Guide
item.description:
There are plenty of bosses to fight in Borderlands 4 , and while not all of them are special, the vast majority of them do have unique mechanics. The Bio Bulkhead, for example, may look like just a regular Order Bulkhead, but it is covered in a special bio-armor that makes it immune to all forms of damage.

This boss isn't particularly difficult, but regardless, here's a guide on how to beat the Bio Bulkhead in Borderlands 4 as well as info on what legendary loot you can target farm from it.

How to Reach the Bio Bulkhead Boss in Borderlands 4

The Bio Bulkhead is the boss in One Fell Swoop, one of the main story missions in Borderlands 4 . Here, you'll be storming an Order base in hopes of getting more info on Idolator Sol's bioweapon. The mission takes place in the Dissected Plateau mission, and in order to get to the Bio Bulkhead boss, you need to pass through the Order base again .

Make sure to go up the elevator once you reach the main hall.

If you're already finished with the One Fell Swoop mission, you can simply run past every enemy in the facility until you reach the boss room. For an easier time getting to the Bio Bulkhead boss, mark the location of its dedicated Encore machine, then call out ECHO-4. It will display a path that leads to the Encore machine.

How to Beat Bio Bulkhead in Borderlands 4

This boss introduces players to Locust Canisters, throwable objects that contain Sol's bioweapon. Bio Bulkhead is normally immune to all types of damage, but if you chuck a can of Locust at it , its armor will corrode, leaving it vulnerable to violence.

Locust Canisters will spawn in the dispensers by the pillars near the middle of the arena. If you miss your throw, you'll have to wait a bit for a new canister to spawn. Also, keep in mind that Locust Canisters will only destroy armor around its point of impact â€” if you hit the bulkhead from the front, its rear side will still be armored.

Bio Bulkhead Legendary Loot

Like most bosses in Borderlands 4 , Bio Bulkhead can drop legendary items from the world loot pool as well as its own dedicated loot pool. This boss drops the following legendaries at a higher rate:

  • Waterfall Grenade: A Vladof impact grenade that causes additional explosions when damaging targets.
  • Sho Kunai Grenade: A Jakobs throwing knife that grants you a stacking movement speed bonus every time you hit enemies.
  • Budget Deity Pistol: A Tediore pistol that produces Combo Orbs when thrown. Enemies damaged by Combo Orbs take damage and become marked with Atlas Target Lock.

The Budget Deity could be a good weapon if you want to build around the Atlas Tracker mechanic, but if not, then any other Tediore gun would be better. The Waterfall grenade is also quite good, but you'll want to have some sort of way to avoid blowing yourself up with it.

As cool as it sounds, the Sho Kunai has very little actual use cases. The movement speed buff isn't that strong, and unless it's paired with a build that uses movement speed, then this one is going to be a hard pass for many players.

Borderlands 4
8 /10
8.7 /10
Released
September 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

item.title: Best Open-World Games That Make You Take Notes
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world design often removes explicit markersâ€”note-taking turns vague hints into meaningful progress.
  • Certain titles make memory the mechanicâ€”journals link scattered clues, routes, and fragile story beats.
  • Notes aren't choresâ€”they're part of exploration, preserving discoveries and aiding survival in harsh worlds.

When tackling a daunting open-world adventure, it can be handy to have some direction for where to go next, but sometimes the in-game interfaces and tooltips just aren't enough. In order to keep track of everything that's going on, players often resort to using a trusty pen and paper to help them organize their playthrough.

These notes can take the form of simple reminders for quests or achievements, or can be long-drawn-out sequences about exactly where to go and when. Whatever the case, some open-world games just feel that much easier when supported by a personal set of notes.

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

A World Of Subtle Clues

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
48
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Powered by

Breath of the Wild redefined open-world design by relying less on explicit direction and more on environmental storytelling. Players are given minimal instructions, and are instead encouraged to observe landscapes, weather patterns, and subtle NPC hints, meaning that key discoveries can easily be lost in the vast wilderness.

This freedom transforms exploration into a more deliberate act. The game trusts players to pay attention, rewarding curiosity and persistence with genuine moments of discovery. Recording details of shrine puzzles, recipes, or unusual locations enhances progress and makes every note taken feel like an authentic part of the heroâ€™s journey.

Elden Ring

More Madness Than Mystery At Times

Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Powered by

Elden Ring expands FromSoftwareâ€™s cryptic storytelling tradition into an immense open world, where NPCs provide only scattered dialogue, often referencing characters or locations that are easy to overlook. This makes keeping a journal of interactions and discovered secrets essential for those who wish to experience the full depth of the narrative.

The game's geography is a puzzle in itself, as landmarks, hidden paths, and even the environment often deliver more meaning than spoken words. Careful documentation enables players to connect clues scattered across distant regions, gradually piecing together fragmented histories in a world defined by ruins and forgotten lore.

The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind

Direction Through Disjointed Dialogue

The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
9.3 /10
Released
May 1, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Powered by

The Elder Scrolls 3: Morrowind is perhaps the purest example of an RPG that forces reliance on memory and note-taking. Quest instructions are not marked on a map, and instead, NPCs describe paths using landmarks and directions. Finding a location often requires a high level of attention to detail, and without diligent record-keeping, simple tasks can quickly become overwhelming.

This design fosters deep immersion, as players learn to trust the worldâ€™s geography and logic, rather than automated markers. Maintaining a notebook of quests, faction allegiances, and item locations not only prevents confusion but also builds a sense of ownership over the adventure.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Lost In The Wilderness

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

On its higher difficulty settings, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt removes many of the navigational aids that players take for granted. Quest objectives are no longer neatly marked, and the minimap ceases to serve as a constant compass. The absence of glowing icons changes how the game is played, making the experience more about memory and less about following clear paths.

This design shift transforms the game into a more grounded experience. Following trails, interpreting clues, and recalling prior dialogue feels more rewarding when success depends on careful observation. By jotting down important details, players embrace the role of Geralt as a professional tracker who cannot afford to overlook a single word.

Outer Wilds

The Only Way Forward Is Knowledge

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence, Alcohol Reference
Developer(s)
Mobius Digital
Powered by

Outer Wilds strips away traditional progression systems in favor of pure knowledge accumulation. Advancement comes not from leveling up or acquiring weapons but from piecing together scattered clues about the solar systemâ€™s mysteries, which turns simple notes into important threads for understanding the larger story.

This unique structure makes note-taking indispensable. Every discovered secret reshapes the player's understanding of the world, and remembering how each planetâ€™s mechanics interact is both crucial for survival and deeply satisfying when they come together to solve a particularly tricky puzzle.

Pathologic 2

Memories Become The Reality

Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Violence
Developer(s)
Ice-Pick Lodge
Powered by

Pathologic 2 presents an unforgiving world where every decision carries consequences. Time moves relentlessly forward, and failing to remember schedules, alliances, or hidden resources often leads to irreversible losses, which makes memory and notes the player's most valuable assets.

Unlike many open-world titles, mistakes are permanent. Choices ripple through the narrative, and events unfold whether the player is prepared or not. Note-taking becomes a crucial tool for survival, and by learning how the game works, players can regain a level of control over a world that is otherwise mysterious and hostile.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance

Realism Of The Purest Kind

Kingdom Come: Deliverance
10
7.6 /10
Released
February 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Warhorse Studios
Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance rejects fantasy shortcuts in favor of historical authenticity. NPCs describe directions using landmarks, rivers, and villages, forcing players to carefully track journeys and routes, and by keeping a physical or digital log of these instructions, things become a lot easier to follow.

This emphasis on realism extends to daily life. Writing down alchemy recipes, combat techniques, or local gossip enhances immersion in a world where every detail matters, and the game really respects intelligence and preparation, making note-taking feel like a natural extension of the core experience.

Sable

Mapping Out The Entire Journey

Sable
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
September 23, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Shedworks
Powered by

Sable offers a completely different approach to exploration, emphasizing introspection and discovery over combat. Its vast deserts and strange ruins encourage unguided exploration, and players will often find themselves charting routes, sketching landmarks, or recording symbols to piece together the mysteries scattered across its landscapes.

Note-taking becomes an act of personal expression, mirroring the protagonistâ€™s rite of passage. Keeping track of the player's own journey turns Sable into a deeply personal experience, as the documentation is less about efficiency and more about preserving the joy of the adventure itself.
